original: Hökerberg, Carl Bertil, civilförsvarsdirektör, major, Göteborg, f. 17/ 1/94 i Värnamo landskomm., Jönköp. 1., av bruksföirvailt. Mårten H. o. All-mina Jehander. G. 28 m. Maj Ahn-wall. ’Barn: E:bba f. 31, Kjell Olof 34. — Stud:ex. 15, off:ex. 17, KHS 25-27, mil:förvaltn:kurs 27-29. Luft-sk:stud. i Fink 41. Major på res: stat v. Jönk.-IKailm. reg. 40, civ :försv :dir. i Gbgs o. Boh. 1. sed. 44. Sekr. i Gbgs o. Boh. 1. luftskyddsförb. o. Gbgsor-tens luftskyddsfören., led. av styr. f. Fören. f. Gbgs försvar. Hobby: filateli. RSO, FBskftjMlkl m .sp, RLSF förtj :t. i guld, SvRK förtj :t. i silver.
translated: Hökerberg, Carl Bertil, Civil Defense Director, Major, Gothenburg, b. 17/1/94 in Värnamo municipality, Jönköping County, the son of the works manager Mårten H. and All-mina Jehander. Married in 1928 to Maj Ahnwall. Children: Ebba, b. 1931, Kjell Olof, b. 1934. He passed his student examinations in 1915, graduated from officer training in 1917, attended the Royal Military College from 1925-1927, and took a military administration course from 1927-1929. He studied aviation in Fink in 1941. He became a Major in the reserve force at the Jönköping-Kalmar Regiment in 1940 and was appointed Civil Defense Director in Gothenburg and Bohus County in 1944. He was Secretary of the Gothenburg and Bohus County Air Defense Association and of the Gothenburg Air Defense Society, and a member of the Executive Committee of the Association for the Defense of Gothenburg. His hobby is philately. He is a recipient of the Order of the Sword (RSO), the Swedish Armed Forces' Servants' Cross (FBskftjMlkl m.sp), the Medal of Merit of the Royal Swedish Defense Forces in gold (RLSF förtj:t. i guld), and the Medal of Merit of the Swedish Red Cross in silver (SvRK förtj:t. i silver).
